profile.name: Sandvine Sweden AB
profile.aboutUs:
Application and Network Intelligence
As network and application usage shifts on a daily basis, service providers are looking for new ways to analyze, optimize, and monetize applications so they can deliver high quality consumer and enterprise experiences. This requires changes on three critical fronts:

 

Maintaining accurate visibility of application and network traffic
Encryption renders most existing data collection methods ineffective. As the Internet continues to go dark, a new approach is needed to maintain a high-level of application and network intelligence, but also to ensure accurate charging and sustained profitability for highly valuable services.

 

Understanding contextual application Quality of Experience
Running a profitable network requires a deep understanding of how critical applications, such as video, gaming, social sharing, and enterprise applications are performing. However, most service providers lack the context and the associated key performance indicators needed to truly determine application quality of experience (QoE).

 

Scaling to meet performance and volumetric requirements
As video shifts to HD and 4K streaming, cloud gaming grows in popularity, and new smart workplace and industry applications gain traction, bandwidth usage is exploding with little additional revenues. Meeting this challenge on the data plane requires hyper-scalable software solutions optimized to run in flexible cloud, virtual, and physical deployment models.


Sandvine’s cloud-based Application and Network Intelligence portfolio and pre-packaged use cases help customers analyze, optimize, and monetize application experiences using contextual machine learning-based insights and real-time actions. Market-leading classification of more than 95% of traffic in real time across mobile and fixed networks by user, application, device, and location significantly enhances interactions between users and applications.

 

Sandvine is deployed by over 200 of the largest service providers globally, serving over 2.5 billion users in more than 100 countries. These service providers choose Sandvine on a daily basis for the following reasons:

 

Global Internet Authority 
The leading authority on the continuously evolving internet phenomena dominating global networks


Application and Network Intelligence-Based Solutions
Combines unparalleled application visibility with contextual awareness to deliver complete and comprehensive solutions in key areas: Video, Gaming, Social Sharing, Enterprise Managed Services, and Internet of Things


Best Real-Time Application and Network Data for Inline Actions
Real-time, high-definition granularity with the industry’s most accurate application classification


Single Pane of Glass 
Sandvine’s Application and Network Intelligence (ANI) Portal visualizes contextual data, and provides unique application and network QoE scoring metrics critical for improving performance


Proven Leadership for Real-Time Actions
Trusted for over 20 years in large scale communications networks as the ‘internal engine’ for intelligent policy control and mitigation


Analytics-Driven Automation 
Automation-based use cases drive decisions and actions in a closed-loop cycle, and deliver operational savings and improved efficiency to solve current and future application and network challenges

This journey was accelerated in 2021 where the “Growing Green” strategy was launched, where RWE will invest 500 billion SEK in renewable technologies towards 2030. 

RWE Renewables is the entity of RWE driving the transition focusing on developing, constructing and operating renewable assets across a variety of technologies; offshore wind, onshore wind, solar PV, battery and hydrogen. 

In the Nordic countries, RWE Renewables are running operations for more than 1 GW of onshore and offshore wind capacity. RWE Renewables has for many years been a leading player in onshore wind. We are also a front runner in offshore wind, where we are constructing Thor in Denmark, the largest offshore wind farm in the Nordic countries, and are in the late development stage of another significant offshore wind farm project in Sweden, Södra Victoria.

Asperiq's network encryption technology is built upon an in-house developed Hardware Security Trust Anchor, crafted by our leading security experts in Lund. 

Our commitment to keeping your nation safe is unwavering, with no room for compromises.

profile.name: European Spallation Source ERIC (ESS)
profile.didYouKnow: The European Spallation Source is one of the largest science and technology infrastructure projects being built today. The facility design and construction include the most powerful linear proton accelerator ever built, a five-tonne, helium-cooled tungsten target wheel, 22 state-of-the-art neutron instruments, a suite of laboratories, and a supercomputing data management and software development centre. In the context of its history and future as a scientific organisation, however, it is more than the sum of its parts. It is a brand new Big Science organisation, built from the ground up.
profile.aboutUs: The European Spallation Source is under construction on the outskirts of Lund, a city in southern Sweden. The facility's unique capabilities will both greatly exceed and complement those of today's leading neutron sources, enabling new opportunities for researchers across the spectrum of scientific discovery, including materials and life sciences, energy, environmental technology, cultural heritage and fundamental physics.

profile.name: Neo4j
profile.didYouKnow: Being a persistent store of connected information, Neo4j plays an essential role within Generative AI applications. Neo4j is used together with Large Language Models (LLMs) to create applications like chatbots, recommendation systems, and knowledge retrieval. Neo4j can serve as a complement to LLMs, keeping their output grounded, traceable, and accurate.
profile.aboutUs:
Neo4j is the clear leader in the rapidly emerging graph database category. Our internet-scale graph platform helps companies around the world connect data to reveal invisible contexts and hidden relationships that drive breakthrough applications and analytics.

We build technology that helps cure cancers, addresses diabetes, and gets humans to Mars. We're proud to fight fraud, crush pandemics, and even help journalists uncover the secrets in the Panama papers.

Do you like to solve advanced and complex computer science problems? Do you like to be part of a team that values user success and where you can have intellectually honest discussions? Join our engineering headquarters located in Malmö, Sweden. You will also work with colleagues from our London office.

profile.name: Preem AB
profile.didYouKnow:
- Preem is Sweden’s largest fuel company.
- 2035 at the latest we will have climate-neutral operations with net-zero emissions throughout the value chain. 
- Our refineries in Gothenburg and Lysekil are among the most modern and environmentally friendly refineries in the world. 
- Every day, we supply vital functions with Swedish-produced fuels.
- Two thirds of our production are exported. This means that Preem is one of Sweden's largest export companies.
profile.aboutUs:
Preem is Sweden’s largest fuel company. Our vision is to lead the transition toward a sustainable society. By 2035 Preem will produce 5 million cubic meters of renewable fuels and achieve climate neutrality. 

Our two refineries are among the most modern and environmentally adapted in Europe with a refining capacity of over 18 million cubic meters per year. The business we are in includes trading, production, distribution and sales. We refine and sell fuel, heating and lubricating oil as well as other products to companies and individuals. 

Two thirds of our production are exported are exported to the international market, mainly to north western Europe. We have a nationwide service network with 520 filling stations for private and commercial traffic. Preem AB has around 1,500 employees, of which 1,100 work at our refineries. In 2022, Preem’s turnover was SEK 161 billion.

profile.name: Flower Infrastructure Technologies AB
profile.aboutUs:
We believe that renewable electricity is the future and our best way of fighting against climate change. However, for us to rely mostly on renewable electricity fundamental changes to the current electricity power system must take place. And we want to lead this transformation!

At Flower, we operate our Digital Power Refinery Platform also known as a virtual power plant (VPP). To our digital platform, we connect to and control a vast pool of generation, consumption, and storage assets from large-scale industrial facilities to decentralized energy resources which we optimize to produce the most benefit for the electricity system both locally, regionally, and system-wide. We are currently expanding the team and entering an exciting phase of launching our solutions in new European markets. 

Are you interested in helping us to keep developing exceptional energy solutions, connecting over 5000 existing assets to our platform? Then come and join us at Flower!

profile.name: L'Oréal
profile.aboutUs:
Leading the world in beauty and pioneering the world of beauty tech; we are 87,4K employees across 150 countries on five continents and has a unique international portfolio of 36 brands. The Group generated sales amounting to 38,26 billion euros in 2022, and e-commerce accounted for 28% of the Group’s sales. We push boundaries and move fast globally to stay ahead of the game. As market leader, we continuously deliver innovation and digital solutions that can bring beauty to all people around the world. L’Oréal truly embraces entrepreneurship, and you’ll have the chance to conceptualize ideas and bring them to life in an agile way not least through continued digital innovation. Your job will be your own innovation playground. 

What we do at L’Oréal always have a big impact. At L’Oréal, we define success as making a positive, conscious impact. We’ve been recognized as the World most ethical company in the world by Ethisphere®. For the seventh time in a row, L’Oréal has been recognized as a global leader in sustainable development by the international non-profit organization CDP® in three areas: combating climate change, sustainable management of water and protecting forests, for the fourth year running. In 2022, L’Oréal was for the 6th consecutive year recognized by the Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index (GEI) for having successfully created an inclusive and equal work environment. We believe diversity fosters creativity and accelerates innovation. To ensure that our products meet the needs of every form of beauty in every culture, our team members must be as diverse and inclusive as the world itself.  For us, our job is more than just a job, it is about building a better future for others and our planet. 


Freedom to Go Beyond. That’s the Beauty of L’Oréal.

profile.name: Thule Group AB
profile.didYouKnow: Thule Group has about 2,600 employees at nine production facilities and 35 sales offices worldwide. The Group’s products are sold in 138 markets and in 2022, sales amounted to SEK 10.1 billion.
profile.aboutUs: Thule Group is a global sports and outdoor company. We offer high-quality products with smart features and a sustainable design that make it easy for people across the globe to live an active life. Under the motto Active Life, Simplified — and with a focus on consumer-driven innovation and long-term sustainability — we develop, manufacture and market products within the product categories Sport&Cargo Carriers (roof racks, roof boxes and carriers for transporting cycling, water and winter sports equipment, and rooftop tents mounted on a car), Juvenile & Pet Products (strollers, bike trailers, child bike seats and products to bring your dog), RV Products (awnings, bike carriers and tents for RVs and caravans) and Packs, Bags & Luggage (hiking backpacks, luggage and camera bags).

Our company was founded on a single brilliant invention and innovation remains at the heart of everything we do. With the vision of creating better everyday conditions for people, Alfa Laval has developed products since 1883.

profile.name: Diaverum AB

In over 450 clinics in 24 countries, we are more than 14,000 people delivering 6 million treatments annually, through our values of competence, passion and inspiration. Our vision is to transform renal care, supported by a continuously evolving digital infrastructure, delivering the highest quality of care for patients while reducing costs, and partnering with local communities to educate them about kidney health and the value of prevention.

profile.name: Nordic Sugar AB
profile.didYouKnow: Did you know that the sugar beet consists of 75% water?
profile.aboutUs:
At Nordic Sugar Sweden, we work with the sustainable food chain in focus - and to constantly develop new, resource-smart solutions. Our ambition is to have a completely carbon-neutral production by 2045. At our sugar factory in Örtofta, we are now finalizing a facility to take fossil-free energy from a nearby heating plant, which from 2022 will mean a direct reduction of fossil energy by up to 25%. A large part of our products are transported by train.
Our sugar beet comes from around 1,000 growers in southern Sweden and our products are sold under the brands Nordic Sugar for industry and Dansukker for consumers. From the residues of sugar production we make high quality animal feed. Nordic Sugar Sweden has an attractive location in the middle of the food region Skåne, just outside the university city Lund, and the company offers good career opportunities. We are part of Nordzucker, one of Europe's leading sugar producers, with a turnover of around €1.5 billion.

profile.name: Elcowire AB
profile.didYouKnow: We are currently looking for students who wants summer jobs, to do their thesis at Elcowire.

The production plants are located in Helsingborg-Sweden, and in Hettstedt-Germany.
